word: The fall of our first parents broke the golden chain of implicit obedience of the human will to the Divine. Obedience has no longer been deemed an absolute necessity. The human agents follow their own imaginations, which the Lord said of the inhabitants of the old world were evil and that continually. The Lord Jesus declares, \93I have kept my Father\92s commandments.\94 How? As a man. \93Lo, I come to do thy will, O God.\94 To the accusations of the Jews He stood forth in His pure, virtuous, holy character and challenged them, \93Which of you convinceth me of sin?\94. . .
